definitions: A barrier, typically made of metal, wood, or concrete, installed along the edge of a road, bridge, or other dangerous area to prevent vehicles or people from falling off or straying into hazardous zones.
Protective measures or limits established to prevent undesirable outcomes or to ensure safety and fairness within a system, process, or activity.
examples: The guardrails along the mountain pass were damaged in the accident.
The project manager implemented strict guardrails to maintain quality control.
New guardrails are needed for the software development process.
